== Collaboration ==

There are <nowiki>[[ContributeToUbuntu|many]]</nowiki> different ways of contributing to Ubuntu. Contributions are valued and recognized whether you contribute to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Artwork|artwork]]</nowiki>, any of the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/|LoCoTeams]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[DocumentationTeam|documentation]]</nowiki>, providing support on the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/|forums]]</nowiki>, the <nowiki>[[https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu|answers tracker]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/ChannelList|IRC support]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BugSquad|bug triage]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Translations|translation]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuDevelopment|development]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU|packaging]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MarketingTeam|marketing]]</nowiki> and advocacy, or anything else. The whole community needs each other and depends on each other. Whichever way you choose to bring benefit to Ubuntu and help others is very much appreciated.

Ubuntu also benefits from contributions to <nowiki>[[Upstream|upstream projects]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[Debian]]</nowiki> specifically. However, while contributions to those projects are appreciated and worth being recognized, involvement in downstream Ubuntu is required for membership. After all itâ€™s all about ''Ubuntu membership''. :)

The idea that ''only'' technical contributions (like patches or uploads of packages) or ''only'' contributions which give rise to karma in Launchpad is incorrect. The community is much broader and more diverse than that and it is sufficient to demonstrate significant and sustained contributions in any area of the Ubuntu community. It is important that members demonstrate the ability to interact with others, so detailed endorsements from others are important criteria that are evaluated during your application, because they give better insight into specific parts of the community. Testimonials from members of various parts of the community are appreciated, even if they're not Ubuntu members themselves.

=== Upstreams ===

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border: none;">
| <style="border:none; width:99%; text-align: center;"><nowiki>[[Upstream|<nowiki>[[File:opensource-logo-rev1.jpg|ways to collaborate|width=200]]</nowiki></nowiki>]]
| <style="border:none">
|}

The work done in other Open Source communities is vitally important to Ubuntu. If you are part of one of Ubuntu's Upstreams we appreciate your work. If your collaboration with the Ubuntu project and involvement in the Ubuntu project constitutes as a significant and sustained contribution, you are eligible to Ubuntu membership.

Some examples in what constitute valuable contributions for getting the Ubuntu membership follow:

* Somebody working hard on Launchpad or some other piece of infrastructure, supporting and coordinating with the Ubuntu developers for months.
* Somebody working on upstream project X that dealt with loads of Ubuntu bugs and coordinated releases together with Ubuntu developers.
* Somebody working with hardware manufacturers to get Ubuntu pre-installed in an specific market.

When applying for Ubuntu membership, please make the relevance of your work to the Ubuntu project very clear.

=== Ubuntu Community ===

* Voting privileges to confirm Ubuntu <nowiki>[[CommunityCouncil|Community Council]]</nowiki> nominations.
* An <nowiki>[[UbuntuEmail|@ubuntu.com]]</nowiki> email alias that forwards to your real email address.
* An <nowiki>[[IRC-Cloaks|''ubuntu-member-your_nick'' cloak]]</nowiki> on freenode.
* The right to print <nowiki>[[BusinessCards|business cards]]</nowiki> with the Ubuntu logo, you will need to take care of the printing.
* Syndication on <nowiki>[[http://planet.ubuntu.com/|Planet Ubuntu]]</nowiki> of your Ubuntu blog. Follow the <nowiki>[[PlanetUbuntu|registration instructions]]</nowiki> to add your blog!
* An <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=445211|Ubuntu Member]]</nowiki> title at the Ubuntu Forums.
* SFTP access to a Web-accessible directory on <nowiki>[[PeopleUbuntuCom|people.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki>
* A <nowiki>[[https://forms.canonical.com/certificate/|certificate]]</nowiki> signed by <nowiki>[[http://www.markshuttleworth.com/|sabdfl]]</nowiki> (Self appointed benevolent dictator for life) Mark Shuttleworth.

=== 3rd Party ===

* A <nowiki>[[~chilicuil-sandbox-Membership-LWN|subscription]]</nowiki> to <nowiki>[[http://www.lwn.net|Linux Weekly News]]</nowiki>.
* Ability to join the <nowiki>[[~chilicuil-sandbox-Membership-LinkedIn|Official Ubuntu Members]]</nowiki> group on <nowiki>[[ http:--www.linkedin.com- | LinkedIn ]]</nowiki>.
* Signing up for <nowiki>[[https://www.sixxs.net/|SixXS]]</nowiki> account with an Ubuntu email address and a link to your Launchpad page will grant you an "Ubuntu Credit Bonus" of 25 <nowiki>[[https://www.sixxs.net/faq/account/?faq=credits|credit points]]</nowiki>.
* Ubuntu Member <nowiki>[[http://www.reddit.com/r/Ubuntu/comments/l5b3x/members_and_canonical_employees_claim_your_flair/|Flair]]</nowiki> on Reddit.
* <nowiki>[[~chilicuil-sandbox-Membership-Gandi|Discounted]]</nowiki> domain registration pricing and partner rates for cloud hosting at <nowiki>[[https://www.gandi.net/|Gandi.net]]</nowiki>.
